column4: Hi everyone. My Ubuntu installation started doing a weird thing today. When I load some web pages, external files (e.g. CSS, JS, etc) will not load. From what I can see, it's only when those files are from a subdomain. Any ideas? It does this in all browsers, but when I try on Windows, it works fine.
something is blocking them, some software id assume
not sure what it could be, I didn't install anything recently.
thanks anyway, will keep on trying.
i couldnt imagen such an issue thats all, sorry mate
to be honest id be doing a fresh install and get on these sites straight away and install stuff one by one till my setup is complete
I had extreme laptop issues with 9.10 only thing that solved it was #ubuntu+1 (Developement next release 10.4 lucid) if you should find yourself banging you head agaisnt the wall
havnt had any issues with it so far
ok thanks. I'm still on 9.04, cuz I had problems with 9.10. Might have to try 10.04 then. Is yours relatively stable?
havnt had an issue yet mate, and ive slammed it from pentesting to everyday home/office usuage.
Ok, will consider it. I just find it strange that this problem comes up from one day to the next, without any major changes to the system.

what ikonia said is true, but many people ive solved laptop issues with have agreed, i would suggest not upgrading like ikonia is suggesting but a clean install if you did need to attempt that. install 9.10 and debug first tho :)
yeah, I was thinking of trying 9.10, but haven't decided yet.
i always prefer clean installs, but i cannot say a upgrade wouldnt help
